meanings.sent1: I tug the rope to move the heavy box.
meanings.sent2: She tugs the dog gently to bring it closer.
meanings.sent3: The little boy tries to tug the huge tree, thinking it will move.
meanings.sent4: Memories tug at my heart, reminding me of the past.
meanings.sent5: The wind tugs at the flag, making it flutter in the breeze.

meanings.sent1: With a quick tug, he pulled the door open.
meanings.sent2: She felt a sudden tug on her fishing line.
meanings.sent3: The tug of the magnet was surprisingly strong.
meanings.sent4: The tug of war game ended in a tie.
meanings.sent5: The tug of the waves dragged the boat closer to the shore.

meanings.definition: A struggle or fight for control
meanings.sent1: There was a tug between the two teams for the trophy.
meanings.sent2: The tug for power led to a heated argument.
meanings.sent3: The tug for the last cookie ended in laughter.
meanings.sent4: The tug for attention in the classroom was noticeable.
meanings.sent5: The tug for the remote control caused a playful scuffle.
